instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
Hi all

I have a frustrating 3000$ fully specced problem on my hands and I need some experience shared to help me fix this problem.

Above mentioned MacBook came for EFI password removal that legit owned brought in, I've unlocked it and the owner was able to log in and all was good (friend - favor...). After 4-5 days he got back and wanted me to re install OS on it and after backing up and wiping SSD I rebooted it to a black screen. I got all major voltages:  5v, 3v3, G3HOT is (12v3), 1v05, 0.95 1V8 you name it.

The thing I am missing now is back light power enable signal. No USB activity and no picture on external monitor. All <SIGNAL>PM_SLP</SIGNAL> lines are present,<SIGNAL>CPU_PRWGOOD</SIGNAL> is 1V, CPU VCORE is 0V80 to 0V95 and only thing of "concern" is that south bridge is slightly warm to the touch ( i don't remember it being that way!) Also, laptop powers on and can be powered down via power button, battery is charging in normal fashion (20V, amperage varies)
I can provide any relevant info as I am stuck with this board for months now, waiting for a spare board for parts. Board view and schematics are present and helpful. No water dmg, no physical dmg.  

Any help, suggestion or hint is much appreciated. 

Let me just mention that I am not new in this type of work, just this model is a first one that I am working on so lack of experience is a factor - so I am reaching out for it (:

Thank you and I will really appreciate any help.

Regards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message: Sounds like the BIOS is not clean what did you do to remove the EFI code?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
Edited [B]CBF2CC32 [/B]string only. In desperation even flashed back the original BIOS - no cigar :/

Following this research - [URL]https://reverse.put.as/2016/06/25/apple-efi-firmware-passwords-and-the-scbo-myth/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message: Also due to that relative heating of SR2NH (QMS180) chipset I got a "new" one but I am more willing to exhaust all other relevant measurements before replacing that chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
Check for solders, traces and knocked off components around SPI chip.
Did you try PRAM reset and SMC reset?

If you deal with Apple stuff, get Medusa programmer; it allows you to properly change BIOS content.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
No, not on regular basis but thanks for the hint, will try and post results. 

Got couple of programmers for 25 series eeproms so I am good there, thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
I mean Medusa can change serial number and fix checksum after.
It properly clean ME region, which no other programmer and software does it.
You can also disable GPU on 2011 boards with it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message: PRAM or SMC reset didn't do anything :/ Even replaced the BIOS chip with a new one a programmed it with original locked file externally - no dice!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message: Try known good BIOS dump from other board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A powers on - no picture
threads.message:
PROGRESS!!!

Removing life boat connector gave me picture/flashing question mark folder, managed to run diagnostic and got VDH002 error (with connector back on).

Never got this far, so any idea would be highly appreciated, thanks!
